bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: a) of shang han 傷寒 , harm caused by cold, resulting in a flourishing of only yang qi and a diminution of yin qi, with cold extremities and a greenish facial complexion, pain in the abdomen and affecting the entire body, as well as a deep-lying and fine movement in the vessels. Jin gui yao lue 金匱要略 Fj: 陰毒之為病，面目青， 身痛如被杖，咽喉痛 , “The disease of yin poison is as follows: the face and eyes are greenish. The body aches as if flogged with a stick. The throat aches”.

b) Brought forth by being struck by xi du 溪毒 , rivulet poison, with ulcers in the body’s lower parts as if caused by the insect stingers or fish. Zhou hou bei ji fang 肘後備急方 7: 若瘡如 蠡魚齒者為陰毒 , “If there are ulcers that appear to result from insect [stingers] or fish teeth, then this is yin poison ”.

② Etiological Agent. identical with du qi 毒氣 , poison qi, with a cold quality. Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 19: 陰毒 內行，臟腑受客邪之氣，則病生矣 , “When yin poison moves inside and the depots and palaces receive visitor evil qi, a disease is generated”. ③ Pharmacological Quality of pharmaceutical substances with a poisonous nature of massive cold”. Zheng lei ben cao 證類本草 Substance Entry qian 鉛 quotes Tai qing fu lian ling sha fa 太清服煉靈砂法 : 錫鉛…服之而多陰毒，傷人心胃 , “Tin and lead, if one consumes them one ingests much yin poison , and this will harm the heart and stomach”.
